intro: Elatostema ficoides var. puberulum, commonly known as the velvet leaf elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. It produces small greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
